summary: Freshworks provides customer engagement software including CRM, helpdesk, and sales tools designed for ease of use and fast deployment.
about: Freshworks (founded in Chennai) builds cloud-based customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes. Their products include Freshdesk (support), Freshsales (CRM), and Freshservice (ITSM).
pricing: Freshworks offers multiple tiers for different products: a Free or Starter tier for small teams, and paid tiers (Growth, Pro, Enterprise) that add automation, reporting, and integrations. Exact prices vary by product and seat count; see product pages for current pricing.

faq.question: What does Freshworks do?
faq.answer: Freshworks provides a suite of cloud-based tools for customer support, sales CRM, and IT service management to help teams manage customer conversations, track leads, and automate workflows.

faq.question: Do you have a free tier?
faq.answer: Yes — many Freshworks products offer a free or starter tier for small teams, which includes basic ticketing, contact management, or service desk features.

faq.question: Who is Freshworks for?
faq.answer: Freshworks serves small to mid-sized businesses and enterprises that need simple-to-deploy customer engagement software. Products are used by support teams, sales teams, and IT operations.

faq.question: How does pricing work?
faq.answer: Pricing is typically per user per month and depends on the product and selected tier (Starter/ Growth/ Pro/ Enterprise). Add-ons and advanced features may cost extra. For accurate pricing, refer to the product pricing page or contact sales.

faq.question: Can I integrate Freshworks with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes — Freshworks products offer integrations with popular tools like Slack, Zapier, Google Workspace, and other CRMs. The available integrations depend on the product and plan.

faq.question: Is there a trial available?
faq.answer: Most Freshworks products offer a free trial period for paid tiers so teams can test features before purchasing.
